H0.text: Mammals replenish a large portion of the atmospheric oxygen supply in the oxygen cycle.

H1.text: Fungi replenish a large portion of the atmospheric oxygen supply in the oxygen cycle.

H2.text: Insects replenish a large portion of the atmospheric oxygen supply in the oxygen cycle.

H3.text: Plants replenish a large portion of the atmospheric oxygen supply in the oxygen cycle.

A4.text: Photosynthesizing organisms include the plant life of the land areas, as well as the phytoplankton of the oceans.

A5.text: The main way free oxygen is lost from the atmosphere is via respiration and decay, mechanisms in which animal life and bacteria consume oxygen and release carbon dioxide.
